rationale: Includes Pulmicort Flexhaler 400 µg, two puffs AM and bedtime, 12-hour gap and "until the smoke clears," but does not explicitly state "escalation from 200 µg" wording.
States rinse, gargle, spit to prevent hoarseness/thrush and to call if metallic taste or voice changes occur.
Documents discarding 200 µg cartridges, keeping 400 µg cartridges dry, and faxing pharmacy for two 400 µg cartridges (one spare).
Contains noon-and-bedtime split dosing if travel disrupts schedule and advice to call if rescue inhaler reaches four sprays.
Patient issues (mixing cartridges, skipped rinses on bus, scratchy throat, no chest tightness) are not recorded.
Basketball trip mentioned only indirectly (“for the trip”); length and start date omitted.
Includes reminder to swish/rinse at school restroom when rinse is skipped on bus.
Captures most key decisions and instructions but misses patient-reported symptoms and trip details.
Strength conflict: dispensing note lists 90 µg device, creating a mis-stated numeric detail; other numbers correct.
No unrelated history, vitals, or fabricated data added.
